noun.description: The system of land tenure by which an area of arable land or pastureland is divided into irregular strips, each of which is then allocated by lot to a tenant on a rotation system; = runrig.
Arable land or pastureland held under this system; a strip of such land.

adjective.description: Held under or designating the system of land tenure by which an area of arable land or pastureland is divided into irregular strips and allocated to tenants.

origin: Late Middle English (in an earlier sense). From run + dale.
